title: ByteDance Stops AI Videos After Disney Complains
summary: ByteDance, a big tech company from China, has promised to limit its AI video app called Seedance. This happened after Disney, a famous entertainment company, threatened to take legal action. Disney said Seedance was using its characters like Marvel superheroes and Star Wars figures without permission. Many people online have been making videos with Seedance that look very real, but this has worried Hollywood studios. ByteDance says it respects copyrights and is working to stop users from misusing others' property. They have already stopped users from uploading real people's images. The app creates videos from text prompts, and some clips have become very popular. ByteDance did not share details about how it will protect copyrights.

keywords.explanation: A large technology company from China that makes apps.
A computer program that uses artificial intelligence to create videos.
A famous company that makes movies and characters like Marvel and Star Wars.
Using someone else's creative work without permission.
The name of the AI video app made by ByteDance.
When someone takes steps to sue or go to court over a problem.

Because ByteDance made a deal with OpenAI
questions.correct_answer: Because Seedance used Disney characters without permission

background_read: This article is about a conflict between a tech company and an entertainment giant over copyright issues. ByteDance created an AI app that makes videos, but Disney accused it of using copyrighted characters without permission. Copyright means you need permission to use someone else's creative work, like characters from movies. AI tools like Seedance can create realistic videos from text, which is new and exciting but can cause problems if not used properly. Companies like ByteDance must follow rules to protect others' property.
Article_Structure: WHO: ByteDance and Disney are the main companies involved.
WHAT: ByteDance is limiting its AI video app Seedance after Disney threatened legal action for copyright infringement.
WHERE: This is happening online and involves companies from China and the US.
WHY: Because Disney accused Seedance of using its characters without permission, and ByteDance wants to respect copyrights and avoid legal trouble.

perspectives.description: Disney believes ByteDance is stealing its characters and wants to protect its intellectual property through legal threats.
ByteDance says it respects copyrights and is taking steps to prevent misuse, though it hasn't shared details.
